ThingDef.label: Power Conduit
ThingDef.description: A set of electrical cables for moving power around. Can be placed under walls and other buildings.

ThingDef.label: Heavy Power Conduit
ThingDef.description: A set of heavy electrical cables for moving power around. They are very strong and non-flammable.

ThingDef.label: Power Switch
ThingDef.description: Switches power on/off.

ThingDef.label: Battery
ThingDef.description: Stores electricity when there is excess power and yields it when there is not. Warning - charged batteries tend to explode when heated or wet. Holds up to 1,000 W.

ThingDef.label: Fission Battery
ThingDef.description: Stores electricity and recycles charge using fission processes. Slightly more efficient than standard batteries. Warning - charged batteries tend to explode when heated or wet. Holds up to 4,000 W.

ThingDef.label: Solar Generator
ThingDef.description: Produces electricity from sunlight. Does not work in the dark. Power output: 1,700 W at maximum sunlight.

ThingDef.label: Wind Turbine
ThingDef.description: A wind-powered electrical generator. Requires a large clear space in front and behind for optimal air flow. Power output: 1,050 W at maximum wind speed.

ThingDef.label: Steam Generator
ThingDef.description: The Steam Generator produces electricity. Requires a hopper filled with Ethanol Fuel or Kindling for a fuel source. Power output: 750 W.

ThingDef.label: Corpse-fired Generator
ThingDef.description: Produces power by consuming corpses. Show your enemies you mean business!

ThingDef.label: BioGenerator
ThingDef.description: A BioGenerator that produces electricity. Requires a hopper filled with BioDiesel or BioMatter for a fuel source. Power output: 950 W.

ThingDef.label: BioRefinery
ThingDef.Description: A machine for making BioDiesel and Silage.

ThingDef.label: Coal Power Plant
ThingDef.description: The Coal Power Plant produces electricity by burning coal-like fuels. Requires a hopper filled with Coal Ore, Charcoal or Peat. Power output: 2,300 W.

ThingDef.label: Fuel Power Plant
ThingDef.description: A Fuel Power Plant that produces electricity. Requires a hopper filled with Fuel. Power output: 2,800 W.

ThingDef.label: Geothermal Generator
ThingDef.description: Produces electricity from geothermal steam geysers. Must be placed on a steam geyser. Power output: 2,500 W.

ThingDef.label: Thermoelectric Generator
ThingDef.description: Produces electricity from differences in temperatures between two rooms. Should be placed in a wall. Example: At 1,600 C (2,912 F) difference, power output is 16,200 W at 600% efficiency.

ThingDef.label: Nuclear Power Plant
ThingDef.description: A Nuclear Power Plant with 20,000 W power output. Requires a hopper with Enriched Uranium as a fuel source. WARNING: In case of a nuclear meltdown, build walls around the debris to contain the radiation!

ThingDef.label: Nuclear Power Plant Debris
ThingDef.description: Radioactive debris of a Nuclear Power Plant. Build walls around it to contain the radiation!

ThingDef.label: Military Nuclear Plant
ThingDef.description: A small Military Nuclear Power Plant with 12,000 W power output. Nuclear warheads can be made here. Requires a hopper with Enriched Uranium as a fuel source. WARNING: In case of a nuclear meltdown, build walls around the debris to contain the radiation!

ThingDef.label: Military Nuclear Plant Debris
ThingDef.description: Radioactive debris of a Military Nuclear Plant. Build walls around it to contain the radiation!

ThingDef.label: Capsule Reactor
ThingDef.description: A high-tech portable fusion reactor. Provides a constant power supply regardless of environmental factors.

ThingDef.label: Gause Wind Turbine
ThingDef.description: A wind-powered gause electrical generator. Please keep all limbs and pets away from the turbine area! Power output: 2250 W at maximum wind speed.

ThingDef.label: Tesla Lightning Generator
ThingDef.Description: Harness the incredible power source of lightning through the invention of Nikola Tesla, the Tesla Lightning Generator! It needs to cool off from time to time when it gets too hot. Power output: 6,000 W.

ThingDef.label: Plasma Reactor
ThingDef.Description: Produces tax-free electricity from a steam geyser. Must be placed on a steam geyser. A Plasma Generator can be linked to absorb plasma discharges.

ThingDef.label: Plasma Generator
ThingDef.Description: Produces tax-free electricity through plasma discharges from a Plasma Reactor. It needs to be fully charged first.

ThingDef.label: Xenon-Ion Turbine
ThingDef.description: Must be placed on a steam geyser. The Xenon-Ion Turbine produces power from extreme heat, and efficiency can go above 100%. Example: At 250 C (482 F) power output is 5,000 W with 150% efficiency.

ThingDef.label: Antimatter Reactor
ThingDef.description: The contained antimatter separates from normal matter by magnetic fields so that no unintended reactions take place. The energy would then be extracted in much the same way that nuclear reactors capture the expended heat and light energy from fission reactions. Power output: 30,000 W.
